meanings.definition: A small line made of two strands twisted together, used for seizing or binding.
meanings.sent1: The sailor used a piece of marline to secure the sail to the mast.
meanings.sent2: I found a roll of marline in the toolbox to tie up the loose ends.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the marline, thinking it was a new toy.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a marline, binding our friendship even tighter.
meanings.sent5: The marline felt rough in my hands, reminding me of its strength.

meanings.definition: To bind or fasten with marline.
meanings.sent1: He decided to marline the boxes together for extra security during the move.
meanings.sent2: She carefully marlined the ropes to prevent them from tangling.
meanings.sent3: The chef marlined the pastry edges together to create a beautiful design.
meanings.sent4: His words marlined our hearts, creating a bond that could not be broken.
meanings.sent5: The artist marlined the colors on the canvas, creating a stunning masterpiece.
